StringTools

type
class
available in
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, php, swf
metadata
:keep
This class provides advanced methods on Strings. It is ideally used with 'using StringTools' and then acts as an extension to the String class. If the first argument to any of the methods is null, the result is unspecified.

Static Methods

inline endsWith(s : String, end : String) : Bool

platforms
cs
Tells if the string s ends with the string end. If end is null, the result is unspecified. If end is the empty String "", the result is true.

inline fastCodeAt(s : String, index : Int) : Int

platforms
cs
Returns the character code at position index of String s. This method is faster than String.charCodeAt() on most platforms. However, unlike String.charCodeAt(), the result is unspecified if index is negative or exceeds s.length. This operation is not guaranteed to work if s contains the \0 character.

hex(n : Int, ?digits : Int) : String

Encodes n into a hexadecimal representation. If digits is specified, the resulting String is padded with "0" until its length equals digits.

htmlEscape(s : String, ?quotes : Bool) : String

platforms
cs
Escapes HTML special characters of the string s. The following replacements are made: - & becomes & - < becomes < - > becomes > If quotes is true, the following characters are also replaced: - " becomes " - ' becomes '

htmlUnescape(s : String) : String

platforms
cs
Unescapes HTML special characters of the string s. This is the inverse operation to htmlEscape, i.e. the following always holds: htmlUnescape(htmlEscape(s)) == s The replacements follow: - & becomes & - < becomes < - > becomes > - " becomes " - ' becomes '

inline isEof(c : Int) : Bool

metadata
:noUsing
platforms
cs

isSpace(s : String, pos : Int) : Bool

platforms
cs
Tells if the character in the string s at position pos is a space. A character is considered to be a space character if its character code is 9,10,11,12,13 or 32. If s is the empty String "", or if pos is not a valid position within s, the result is false.

lpad(s : String, c : String, l : Int) : String

platforms
cs
Concatenates c to s until s.length is at least l. If c is the empty String "" or if l does not exceed s.length, s is returned unchanged. If c.length is 1, the resulting String length is exactly l. Otherwise the length may exceed l. If c is null, the result is unspecified.

inline ltrim(s : String) : String

platforms
cs
Removes leading space characters of s. This function internally calls isSpace() to decide which characters to remove. If s is the empty String "" or consists only of space characters, the result is the empty String "".

replace(s : String, sub : String, by : String) : String

platforms
cs
Replace all occurences of the String sub in the String s by the String by. If sub is the empty String "", by is inserted after each character of s. If by is also the empty String "", s remains unchanged. This is a convenience function for s.split(sub).join(by). If sub or by are null, the result is unspecified.

rpad(s : String, c : String, l : Int) : String

platforms
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, swf
Appends c to s until s.length is at least l. If c is the empty String "" or if l does not exceed s.length, s is returned unchanged. If c.length is 1, the resulting String length is exactly l. Otherwise the length may exceed l. If c is null, the result is unspecified.

inline rtrim(s : String) : String

platforms
cs
Removes trailing space characters of s. This function internally calls isSpace() to decide which characters to remove. If s is the empty String "" or consists only of space characters, the result is the empty String "".

inline startsWith(s : String, start : String) : Bool

platforms
cs
Tells if the string s starts with the string start. If start is null, the result is unspecified. If start is the empty String "", the result is true.

inline trim(s : String) : String

platforms
cs
Removes leading and trailing space characters of s. This is a convenience function for ltrim(rtrim(s)).

urlDecode(s : String) : String

platforms
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, swf
Decode an URL using the standard format.

urlEncode(s : String) : String

platforms
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, swf
Encode an URL by using the standard format.
